Authors: María Mónica Ponce, M. Amalia Scataglini
Title:
Do two South American species of Cheilanthes (Pteridaceae)
traditionally linked to the Cheilanthes marginata group, belong to the
new genus Gaga?
Keywords:
Pteridaceae, South America, Cheilanthes hieronymi,
Cheilanthes poeppgiana, Gaga marginata, homoplasy
Abstract:
The generic identity of Cheilanthes hieronymi and C.
poeppgiana are tested using DNA sequences from matK and rbcL chloroplast
markers. These Southern American species are historically linked to
Cheilanthes marginata, now transfered to the new genus Gaga. The results
confirmed that C. hieronymi is a member of Cheilanthes s. s., while C.
poeppgiana is located outside Gaga and Cheilanthes too. Moreover, the
study ratify that the morphological similarity between the two species
clearly responds to a convergence.
